  • GIC 荣获八年来最佳投资表现
  • 财富基金仍致力于投资中国
  • GIC将增加对私人信贷的配置

全球最大的投资者之一新加坡主权财富基金 GIC (GIC.UL) 在截至 3 月份的财政年度取得八年来的最佳表现后，计划继续在中国投资，尽管地缘政治局势紧张。

其集团首席投资官 Jeffrey Jaensubhakij 告诉路透社，GIC 热衷于投资在中国境内开展业务且不向美国出口的中国公司。

“有些‘中国为中国’类型的投资仍然有意义，”他说。

根据周三发布的年度报告，GIC 截至 2023 年 3 月的年度 20 年实际回报率（其主要业绩指标）为 4.6%，为 2015 年以来的最高水平。相比之下，去年同期为 4.2%。

该集团在中国的投资包括电子商务巨头阿里巴巴（9988.HK）和金融科技子公司蚂蚁集团，该集团表示，其多元化的投资组合和谨慎的投资立场有助于缓冲其投资组合的表现免受2022年市场调整的影响。

GIC 表示，在中国的投资对于多元化投资组合非常重要。

GIC 首席执行官 Lim Chow Kiat 表示：“我们认为，希望建立多元化投资组合的全球投资者必须在这个地方有所涉足或存在。”

GIC 对中国的持续承诺之际，北京正在努力重振大流行后疲软的复苏。

在中国领导人承诺加大对经济的支持力度后，中国股市本周上涨。

知情人士称，金融监管机构在上周五的一次罕见会议上向全球主要投资者表示，中国正在优先考虑经济增长，并将对外资保持开放。

GIC 表示，中国现在的监管更加明确，商业信心正在恢复。

该公司的观点与规模较小的投资公司淡马锡的观点一致，淡马锡本月早些时候对中国科技行业提出了积极的前景。

大力发展基础设施和私人信贷

GIC 基础设施首席投资官 Ang Eng Seng 表示，GIC 每年在基础设施资产上投资 100 亿至 200 亿美元，该投资组合自 2016 年以来增长了五倍，因为投资提供了多元化和稳定的、不受通胀影响的回报。

Jaensubhakij 表示，GIC 还寻求向私人信贷配置更多资本，这是一种新兴的资产类别，在银行流动性收紧的高利率环境中带来了强劲的回报。

根据研究公司主权财富基金研究所的数据， GIC 是全球第七大主权投资者，总资产达 6,900 亿美元。

美国是 GIC 最大的市场，占其投资组合的 38%，而除日本外的亚洲则占 23%。

截至 3 月底，新兴市场股票在 GIC 投资组合中的份额从去年同期的 16% 上升至 17%。

房地产从 10% 上升至 13%，而名义债券和现金则从 37% 下降至 34%。

GIC 的 Lim 警告称，持续的通胀压力导致债券市场在过去一年暴跌。

“潜在的通胀驱动因素尚未完全消失，”他表示。 “通胀率仍然面临着高于央行期望水平的压力。”

Yantoultra Ngui 和 Xinghui Kok 在新加坡的报道；谢宇和朱莉的补充报道；凯恩·吴和克里斯蒂娜·芬奇编辑; Tue, 25 Jul 2023 21:02:11 GMT https://www.reuters.com/business/finance/singapores-gic-bets-china-after-scoring-8-year-high-returns-2023-07-25/ https://www.reuters.com/business/finance/singapores-gic-bets-china-after-scoring-8-year-high-returns-2023-07-25/Yantoultra Ngui, Xinghui Kok GIC PTE结果/（PIX） Texas Instruments forecasts third-quarter revenue below estimates

模拟芯片制造商德州仪器(TXN.O)周二预测第三季度营收将低于华尔街目标，原因是消费者和企业需求复苏缓慢，客户无法下达新的芯片订单。

这家总部位于德克萨斯州达拉斯的公司股价在盘后交易中下跌约 2%。

德州仪器 (TI) 4 月份表示，预计即使在第二季度，库存过剩的客户也将继续消除过剩库存，因为通货膨胀和利率上升侵蚀了工业部门等各个部门的支出，工业部门是其主要市场，约占其收入的 40%。

包括台积电和英飞凌在内的顶级芯片制造商也指出，全球经济困境如何削弱了更广泛的终端市场需求，前者表示，即使对人工智能的高需求也无法抵消普遍的疲软。

该公司预计本季度营收在 43.6 亿美元至 47.4 亿美元之间。 Refinitiv 调查的分析师预计收入将为 46 亿美元。

截至 6 月 30 日的季度收入为 45.3 亿美元，而预期为 43.6 亿美元。

Chavi Mehta 在班加罗尔的报道；编辑：Pooja Desai ; Tue, 25 Jul 2023 20:15:00 GMT https://www.reuters.com/technology/texas-instruments-forecasts-third-quarter-revenue-below-estimates-2023-07-25/ https://www.reuters.com/technology/texas-instruments-forecasts-third-quarter-revenue-below-estimates-2023-07-25/Reuters德州仪器结果/（更新 1，PIX） Factbox: What are global companies saying about China's economy?

在全球第二大经济体因疫情放缓而复苏乏力之际，从银行到芯片制造商等主要全球公司对其中国业务都采取了基本上谨慎的立场。

以下是各公司对最新财报季中国业务的评论：

Savyata Mishra 和 Arunima Kumar 在班加罗尔的报道；编辑：Sriraj Kalluvila ; Tue, 25 Jul 2023 18:13:18 GMT https://www.reuters.com/world/china/what-are-global-companies-saying-about-chinas-economy-2023-07-25/ https://www.reuters.com/world/china/what-are-global-companies-saying-about-chinas-economy-2023-07-25/Reuters公司结果/中国 China's top diplomat calls for joint effort in tackling global security challenges - Xinhua

据中国官方媒体新华社周二报道，中共中央政治局委员王毅呼吁共同努力应对全球安全挑战。

王毅是在南非约翰内斯堡举行的金砖国家国家安全顾问和国家安全高级代表第十三次会晤上发表上述讲话的。

金砖国家是巴西、俄罗斯、印度、中国和南非五个新兴经济体的缩写。

中国周二任命这位资深外交官为新任外交部长，解除了前新星秦刚上任半年后神秘缺席一个月的职务。

秦的继任者王也是他的前任，在2013年至2022年期间担任该职务，当时中美关系已恶化至北京所说的历史最低点。

中共中央外事工作委员会办公室主任王毅呼吁抵制外部干预，维护政治安全。

据新华社报道，他还强调必须遵守《联合国宪章》的宗旨和原则，尊重各国合理安全关切和选择政治制度和发展道路的权利。

王毅表示，应努力通过对话协商解决分歧分歧，反对“脱钩”和“双重标准”行为。

他还强调共同安全，反对零和思维和冷战思维。

据新华社报道，王毅表示，中方愿同金砖国家一道，在应对国际安全挑战方面开展更多务实合作。

新华社补充说，会上，成员国一致同意弘扬金砖国家精神，支持多边主义，反对单边制裁，共同应对恐怖主义、极端主义、跨境犯罪等全球性挑战。

鲁什尼·奈尔 (Roushni Nair) 班加罗尔报道；编辑：Pooja Desai ; Tue, 25 Jul 2023 16:49:19 GMT https://www.reuters.com/world/china/chinas-top-diplomat-calls-joint-effort-tackling-global-security-challenges-2023-07-25/ https://www.reuters.com/world/china/chinas-top-diplomat-calls-joint-effort-tackling-global-security-challenges-2023-07-25/Reuters中国政治/（更新 1） Lower production in Europe hits global steel output

世界钢铁协会周二数据显示，由于欧洲和美洲产量下降，2023年上半年全球粗钢产量同比下降1.1%至9.439亿吨。

数据显示，中国是全球最大的金属生产国和消费国，1-6月产量增长1.3%至535.6吨。

五位知情人士周二表示，几家中国钢厂已收到指示，将今年的产量限制在与 2022 年相同的水平。

花旗分析师周二在一份报告中表示，中国2023年的钢铁产量可能会连续第四年继续徘徊在10亿吨大关附近。

在中国以外，花旗预计下半年钢铁产量将上升，推动全年除中国以外的产量达到 8.47 亿吨，较 2022 年增长 3.6%。

世界钢铁协会还表示，预计受制裁影响的世界第五大生产国俄罗斯上半年产量将增长1%，达到3750万吨。

2022年俄罗斯入侵乌克兰后，俄罗斯停止披露其钢铁产量以及大部分进出口数据。

波琳娜·德维特 (Polina Devitt) 报道 马克·波特 (Mark Potter) 编辑; Tue, 25 Jul 2023 16:37:45 GMT https://www.reuters.com/markets/commodities/lower-product-europe-hits-global-steel-output-2023-07-25/ https://www.reuters.com/markets/commodities/lower-product-europe-hits-global-steel-output-2023-07-25/Reuters全球的钢/ EssilorLuxottica posts Q2 sales growth as China rebounds

豪华眼镜制造商 EssilorLuxottica (ESLX.PA)周二报告称，受欧洲、中东和非洲零售增长和中国持续复苏的推动，第二季度收入增长。

这家生产奥克利 (Oakley) 和雷朋 (Ray-Ban) 太阳镜的制造商表示，第二季度总收入为 67 亿欧元（74 亿美元），按当前汇率计算，与去年相比增长 4.9%。

该集团在一份声明中表示：“雷朋 (Ray-Ban) 和奥克利 (Oakley) 继续稳步前进，而区域品牌 Bolon 在重新开放中国本土市场后，销量增长了三分之二，令人印象深刻”。

EssilorLuxottica 表示，亚太地区成为本季度表现最佳的地区，同时指出北美地区增长放缓。

（1 美元 = 0.9048 欧元）

Federica Mileo 在格但斯克的报道，Angus MacSwan 编辑; Tue, 25 Jul 2023 16:36:29 GMT https://www.reuters.com/business/retail-consumer/essilorluxottica-posts-q2-sales-growth-china-rebounds-2023-07-25/ https://www.reuters.com/business/retail-consumer/essilorluxottica-posts-q2-sales-growth-china-rebounds-2023-07-25/Reuters依视路卢索蒂卡结果/（紧急） Putin set to visit China in October - Kremlin adviser, cited by TASS

据俄罗斯国家通讯社塔斯社报道，克里姆林宫外交政策顾问尤里·乌沙科夫周二对记者表示，俄罗斯总统弗拉基米尔·普京打算于 10 月访问中国，计划此访恰逢“一带一路”论坛。

自去年初以来，中国已成为俄罗斯最重要的盟友，当时西方与莫斯科本已紧张的关系因普京准备向乌克兰派遣武装部队而进一步降温。

普京最后一次访问北京是在入侵之前，俄罗斯称之为“特别军事行动”，并与中国国家主席习近平一起宣布了“无限制”伙伴关系，该伙伴关系已扩展到经济、贸易、政治和军事领域。

中国拒绝将战争归咎于莫斯科，并谴责西方对俄罗斯的制裁，尽管中国通过获得俄罗斯不再向欧洲出售的石油和天然气的折扣而获利，并看到俄罗斯越来越多地使用人民币作为储备货币，而不是美元。

习近平于三月来到莫斯科，与他的“亲爱的朋友”普京签署了一系列经济和其他协议。

中国在莫斯科提交了一份文件，呼吁乌克兰局势缓和并最终停火，但基辅及其西方盟友拒绝了该计划，称这将锁定俄罗斯的领土收益。

菲利克斯·莱特报道；凯文·利菲 (Kevin Liffey) 撰稿，安格斯·麦克斯旺 (Angus MacSwan) 编辑; Tue, 25 Jul 2023 16:29:39 GMT https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/putin-set-visit-china-october-kremlin-adviser-cited-by-tass-2023-07-25/ https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/putin-set-visit-china-october-kremlin-adviser-cited-by-tass-2023-07-25/Reuters俄罗斯中国/外交（更新 1） China appoints Pan Gongsheng as new central bank governor - state media

中国任命以消防技术官僚闻名的潘功胜为中国人民银行新任行长，此前他于本月晋升为央行最高政治职务。

周二，官方媒体证实，自2016年起担任中国最高外汇监管机构负责人的潘将接替受人尊敬的省长易纲，这使他成为自易纲的前任周小春以来第一位兼任这两个职位的人。

潘以对货币投机者采取强硬立场而闻名，还参与了国家银行业改革、收紧房地产市场和金融科技监管以及禁止加密货币。

他上任的任务是应对房地产行业的低迷——房地产行业约占中国经济活动的四分之一——而地方政府债务堆积如山也给银行业和整体经济带来了重大挑战。

美国财政部长珍妮特·耶伦本月访问北京期间会见了潘基文，称他为中国人民银行行长。

虽然潘将同时担任中国人民银行党组书记和央行行长，但随着中国今年采取措施加强党对金融体系的控制，包括计划成立中央金融委员会来监督中国人民银行和其他机构，央行现在向新的监管机构汇报。

新的结构削弱了潘可能像他的两位前任那样支持亲市场改革的预期。

官方媒体称，中国解除了易纲的央行行长职务。

北京新闻编辑室、Kevin Yao 和 Joe Cash 的报道；安德鲁·天堂编辑; Tue, 25 Jul 2023 16:16:18 GMT https://www.reuters.com/world/china/china-appoints-pan-gongsheng-new-central-bank-governor-state-media-2023-07-25/ https://www.reuters.com/world/china/china-appoints-pan-gongsheng-new-central-bank-governor-state-media-2023-07-25/Reuters中国中国人民银行/PAN（更新 1，PIX） Miners boost FTSE 100 on China recovery hopes; Unilever shinesSummary:
  • 联合利华第二季度销售额增长
  • 工业金属矿业指数收于三个月高位
  • 康帕斯集团维持年度展望不变
  • C.本周晚些时候将考虑银行利率决定
  • 富时 100 指数上涨 0.2%，富时 250 指数持平

英国富时 100 指数周二连续第六个交易日上涨，受到最大消费者、中国承诺加大对经济政策支持的矿业股上涨的支撑，而联合利华则因季度销售增长而飙升。

蓝筹富时 100 指数(.FTSE)上涨 0.2%，受益于工业金属矿业股(.FTNMX551020)飙升 3.0%，该指数收于 4 月底以来的最高水平。

在中国最高领导人周一暗示将对消耗大量金属的房地产行业采取更多支持政策后，大多数基本金属价格上涨。

瑞银全球财富管理首席投资官马克·海菲尔(Mark Haefele)在一份报告中表示：“我们认为，中国采取的措施可能会打破信心螺旋式下降，并推动国内驱动的情绪复苏。”

铜矿商安托法加斯塔(ANTO.L)是当日富时 100 指数中表现最好的股票，该股在中国刺激措施的推动下上涨 6.6%。

多芬肥皂和本杰瑞冰淇淋的制造商联合利华(ULVR.L)再次提高价格以弥补成本上升，股价上涨 4.3%。

更广泛的个人护理、药品和杂货店板块(.FTNMX452010)上涨 2.6%。

康帕斯集团(CPG.L)是富时 100 指数中跌幅最大的公司，全球最大的餐饮集团维持年度展望后，该股下跌 5.2%。

摩根大通将在线汽车市场的股票评级从“中性”下调至“减持”后，Auto Trader Group (AUTOA.L)股价下跌 2.3%。

以国内市场为重点的富时 250 指数(.FTMC)持平。

Bridgepoint Group (BPTB.L)是中型股指数中跌幅最大的公司，该另类资产基金管理公司公布上半年核心利润下降，股价下跌 9.8%。

投资者目前关注本周晚些时候美联储、欧洲央行和日本央行的利率决定，而人们普遍预计英国央行下周将实施更多货币政策。

Shashwat Chauhan 和 Khushi Singh 在班加罗尔的报道；索尼娅·奇玛编辑; Tue, 25 Jul 2023 16:10:01 GMT https://www.reuters.com/world/uk/uks-ftse-100-gains-open-mining-boost-unilever-shines-2023-07-25/ https://www.reuters.com/world/uk/uks-ftse-100-gains-open-mining-boost-unilever-shines-2023-07-25/Shashwat Chauhan, Khushi Singh英国股票/（更新2） NXP forecast hints Apple might keep bucking China smartphone slump

恩智浦半导体(NXPI.O)首席执行官库尔特·西弗斯 (Kurt Sievers) 表示，中国低迷的智能手机市场还远未出现反弹，但一位主要非 Android 客户的芯片订单仍与历史趋势相比良好。

总部位于荷兰的恩智浦公司生产一种近场通信芯片，该芯片可用于智能手机，以帮助实现移动支付和其他功能。西弗斯没有透露苹果公司(AAPL.O)的名字，但分析师认为这家 iPhone 制造商是主要客户。

西弗斯在接受路透社采访时发表上述言论的前一天，该公司基于汽车领域的稳步复苏给出了好于预期的销售预测，导致其股价截至周二中午上涨 4.8% 至 221.05 美元。

随着中国经济增长放缓，中国智能手机市场遭受重创，Counterpoint Research 报告称，6 月初的“618”购物季销量下降了 8%。但 Counterpoint 表示，苹果公司抵制了这一趋势，购物期间销售额增长了 8%。

恩智浦的预测表明苹果的强势可能会持续下去。 Sievers 在接受采访时表示，恩智浦预计当前第三季度的移动收入将增长 23%，高于刚刚结束的第二季度的 2.84 亿美元。

路透社调查的经济学家表示，大多数央行将在明年上半年降息，尽管大多数央行预计届时无法实现通胀目标。

路透社过去一个月对全球 500 多名预测人士进行的民意调查发现，尽管过去一年货币政策大幅收紧，但与三个月前相比，48 个经济体中的 28 个经济体 2024 年通胀预期上调，但幅度不大。

由于经济增长好于大多数人的预期，失业率仍然很低，大多数发达经济体的通胀率仍远高于央行的预期，这种情况可能至少持续到明年年底。

与此同时，58%的受访发达经济体上调了今年的增长预测，但只有38%的新兴经济体上调了今年的增长预测，在本周期中，新兴经济体的通胀问题较小，并导致了较温和的货币紧缩。

预计 2023 年全球经济增长 2.7%，高于 4 月份的 2.5%，明年增长 2.7%。

经济韧性使许多经济体的核心通胀（剔除波动较大的食品和能源价格）居高不下。三分之二的经济学家认为，到年底，这一数字只会略有下降。

这些温和的预期并没有阻止经济学家和金融市场交易员呼吁在 2024 年上半年降息，尽管央行行长，特别是发达经济体的央行行长表示，利率需要在更长时间内保持较高水平。

这表明，随着货币宽松的呼声越来越高，未来几个月市场和央行之间将出现一段拉动和推动的时期。

德意志银行宏观策略师亨利·艾伦表示：“历史证据表明，通胀回归目标的最后阶段通常是最困难的，因此，如果通胀确实更具弹性，市场可能会感到意外。”

“最近的经验表明，如果数据有需要，各国央行非常愿意采取强硬立场，而且存在市场再次感到意外的风险。”

当被问及未来几个月核心通胀的哪个驱动因素最具粘性时，近 60% 的经济学家（223 名经济学家中的 135 名）选择了工资。

大多数发达经济体的失业率处于或接近历史低点，预计未来两年不会大幅上升。

荷兰合作银行高级美国策略师菲利普·马雷表示：“只要劳动力市场依然紧张，工人就会继续要求通胀补偿……我们预计核心通胀将逐步下降，但在今年剩余时间内可能会保持在高位。”

在接受调查的九家发达市场央行中，只有日本央行、加拿大央行、瑞士央行和新西兰央行预计将在明年年底前达到通胀目标。

另一项路透调查显示，市场普遍预计美联储将于 7 月 26 日将基准隔夜利率上调25 个基点至 5.25%-5.50%。

美联储加息周期即将结束的预期导致美元兑主要货币走弱，导致美元指数(.DXY)今年下跌约 2%。

对于一直难以跟上美联储加息步伐的新兴市场央行来说，这是个好消息。货币走强使进口产品更便宜，有助于缓解价格压力。

在接受调查的 11 家新兴市场央行中，有 6 家央行预计将在年底前达到或低于目标。

由于头发花白和外交诡计，王被中国官方媒体和网上崇拜者比作“银狐”。他目前担任最高外交政策决策机构——中国共产党外事委员会主席。

瑞恩·吴 (Ryan Woo) 报道； Laurie Chen 在北京的补充报道；乔纳森·奥蒂斯编辑; Tue, 25 Jul 2023 13:34:38 GMT https://www.reuters.com/world/china/chinese-court-begins-appeal-trial-canadian-pop-star-kris-wu-2023-07-25/ https://www.reuters.com/world/china/chinese-court-begins-appeal-trial-canadian-pop-star-kris-wu-2023-07-25/Reuters中国加拿大/吴 (PIX) IMF edges 2023 global economic growth forecast higher, sees persistent challenges

The International Monetary Fund on Tuesday raised its 2023 global growth estimates slightly given resilient economic activity in the first quarter, but warned that persistent challenges were dampening the medium-term outlook.

The IMF in its latest World Economic Outlook said inflation was coming down and acute stress in the banking sector had receded, but the balance of risks facing the global economy remained tilted to the downside and credit was tight.

The global lender said it now projected global real GDP growth of 3.0% in 2023, up 0.2 percentage point from its April forecast, but left its outlook for 2024 unchanged, also at 3.0%.

The 2023-2024 growth forecast remains weak by historical standards, well below the annual average of 3.8% seen in 2000-2019, largely due to weaker manufacturing in advanced economies, and it could stay at that level for years.

"We're on track, but we're not out of the woods," IMF chief economist Pierre-Olivier Gourinchas told Reuters in an interview, noting that the upgrade was driven largely by first-quarter results. "What we are seeing when we look five years out is actually close to 3.0%, maybe a little bit above 3.0%. This is a significant slowdown compared to what we had pre-COVID."

This was also related to the aging of the global population, especially in countries like China, Germany and Japan, he said. New technologies could boost productivity in coming years, but that in turn could be disruptive to labor markets.

The outlook is "broadly stable" in emerging market and developing economies for 2023-2024, with growth of 4.0% expected in 2023 and 4.1% in 2024, the IMF said. But it noted that credit availability is tight and there was a risk that debt distress could spread to a wider group of economies.

The world is in a better place now, the IMF said, noting the World Health Organization's decision to end the global health emergency surrounding COVID-19, and with shipping costs and delivery times now back to pre-pandemic levels.

"But forces that hindered growth in 2022 persist," the IMF said, citing still-high inflation that was eroding household buying power, higher interest rates that have raised the cost of borrowing and tighter access to credit as a result of the banking strains that emerged in March.

"International trade and indicators of demand and production in manufacturing all point to further weakness," the IMF said, noting that excess savings built up during the pandemic are declining in advanced economies, especially in the United States, implying "a slimmer buffer to protect against shocks."

While immediate concerns about the health of the banking sector - which were more acute in April - had subsided, financial sector turbulence could resume as markets adjust to further tightening by central banks, it said.

The impact of higher interest rates was especially evident in poorer countries, driving debt costs higher and limiting room for priority investments. As a result, output losses compared with pre-pandemic forecasts remain large, especially for the world's poorest nations, the IMF said.

LOWER INFLATION

The IMF forecast that global headline inflation would fall to 6.8% in 2023 from 8.7% in 2022, dropping to 5.2% in 2024, but core inflation would decline more gradually, reaching 6.0% in 2023 from 6.5% in 2022 and easing to 4.7% in 2024.

Gourinchas told Reuters it could take until the end of 2024 or early 2025 until inflation came down to central bankers' targets and the current cycle of monetary tightening would end.

The IMF warned that inflation could rise if the war in Ukraine intensified, citing concern about Russia's withdrawal from the Black Sea grain initiative, or if more extreme temperature increases caused by the El Nino weather pattern pushed up commodity prices. That in turn could trigger further rate hikes.

The IMF said world trade growth is declining and will reach just 2.0% in 2023 before rising to 3.7% in 2024, but both growth rates are well below the 5.2% clocked in 2022.

The IMF raised its outlook for the United States, the world's largest economy, forecasting growth of 1.8% in 2023 versus 1.6% in April as labor markets remained strong.

It left its forecast for growth in China, the world's second-largest economy, unchanged at 5.2% in 2023 and 4.5% in 2024. But it warned that China's recovery was underperforming, and a deeper contraction in the real estate sector remained a risk.

The fund cut its outlook for Germany, now forecast to contract 0.3% in 2023 versus a 0.1% contraction in April, but sharply upgraded its forecast for the UK, now expected to grow 0.4% versus a 0.3% contraction forecast in April.

Euro zone countries are expected to grow 0.9% in 2023 and 1.5% in 2024, both up 0.1 percentage point from April.

Japan's growth was also revised upward by 0.1 percentage point to 1.4% in 2023, but the IMF left its outlook for 2024 unchanged at 1.0%.

INTEREST RATES STILL RISING

The rise in central bank policy rates to fight inflation continues to weigh on economic activity, the IMF said, adding that the US Federal Reserve and the Bank of England were expected to raise rates by more than assumed in April, before cutting rates next year.

It said central banks should remain focused on fighting inflation, strengthening financial supervision and risk monitoring. If further strains appeared, countries should provide liquidity quickly, it said.

The fund also advised countries to build fiscal buffers to gird for further shocks and ensure support for the most vulnerable.

"We have to be very vigilant on the health of the financial sector ... because we could have something that basically seizes up very quickly," Gourinchas said. "There is always a risk that if financial conditions tighten, that can have a disproportionate effect on emerging market and developing economies."

The IMF said unfavorable inflation data could trigger a sudden rise in market expectations regarding interest rates, which could further tighten financial conditions, putting stress on banks and nonbank institutions - especially those exposed to commercial real estate.

"Contagion effects are possible, and a flight to safety, with an attendant appreciation of reserve currencies, would trigger negative ripple effects for global trade and growth," the IMF said.

Fragmentation of the global economy given the war in Ukraine and other geopolitical tensions remained another key risk, especially for developing economies, Gourinchas said. This could lead to more restrictions on trade, especially in strategic goods such as critical minerals, cross-border movements of capital, technology and workers, and international payments.

Several Chinese steel mills have received instructions to cap this year's output at the same level as 2022, five people familiar with the matter and analyst reports said on Tuesday, potentially curbing iron ore demand in the world's top steel market.

Three mills owned by the world's biggest steelmaker, state-owned China Baowu Steel Group, were given verbal instructions that output should not exceed that of 2022, said four of the sources, with two adding the orders were delivered yesterday.

None of the people specified which authority issued the orders and all declined to be identified because of the sensitivity of the matter.

A Baowu public relations official said he had no information to share on the matter.

China has mandated zero output growth in its steel sector for the last two years as it seeks to limit carbon emissions by one of its most polluting industries.

In both 2021 and 2022, the state planner announced the zero growth target in the second quarter, but no public announcement has been made this year, leaving the market guessing on Beijing's plans.

China's state planner did not respond to a fax seeking comment on the caps issued at some steel mills.

Some mills in the northern Chinese city of Tianjin were notified to keep steel output below the 2022 level, according to reports by local consultancies Mysteel and Fubao on Tuesday, which did not specify the number of mills.

Some mills in eastern China also received similar instructions, consultancy Shanghai Metals Market said.

However, a dozen mills in northern Chinese cities including Tianjin and Handan contacted by Reuters said they had not yet received any instructions to cap their output.

The most-traded steel rebar contract on the Shanghai Futures Exchange closed daytime trading 1.21% higher at 3,857 yuan ($539.93) per metric ton on Tuesday, the highest since April 20.

China produced 535.64 million metric tons of crude steel in the first half of the year, up 1.3% from the same period last year, data from the National Bureau of Statistics showed.

Output in 2022 fell 1.7% on the prior year to 1.018 billion metric tons.

Shares of China's property developers surged on Tuesday following a sharp selloff in the previous session, after policymakers said they would step up support for the embattled sector.

Hong Kong's Hang Seng Mainland Properties Index (.HSMPI) jumped 12%, while Chinese CSI 300 Real Estate (.CSI000952) gained 7%.

Major developers listed in Hong Kong including Country Garden (2007.HK) and Sunac China (1918.HK) rose 14% while Longfor Group (0960.HK) rallied 23%. Seazen Group (1030.HK) and KWG Group (1813.HK) both firmed 16%.

China's top leaders pledged after a meeting on Monday to ramp up policy support for the economy amid a torturous post-COVID recovery, focusing on boosting domestic demand.

For the property sector, the Politburo, a top decision-making body of the ruling Communist Party, said it is necessary to adapt to the new situation caused by significant changes in market supply and demand, and optimise property policies in a timely manner.

While few details of the support measures were provided, investors focused on one change in tone in particular, which they thought could mean more property stabilisation steps were imminent.

The Politburo did not mention the oft-repeated phrase "houses are for living in, not for speculation" in the statement after the meeting.

"Most important, (Beijing) sent a signal of further easing property restrictions by dropping the phrase...and mentioning streaming property policies," Nomura chief China economist Ting Lu said.

Lu, however, maintained the view that there is no quick fix for the property sector, and the central government would only marginally ease some existing restrictive measures in large cities.

Morgan Stanley said the overall statement by Politburo exceeded investor expectations and that policymakers would likely roll out a "more sensible and forceful package" that could include easing second home purchase restrictions in second tier cities.

In recent weeks, investors were wary of a deepening debt crisis in the property sector as new signs of trouble emerged among state-backed property developers Sino-Ocean Group (3377.HK) and Greenland Holdings (600606.SS) , as well as property giants Country Garden (2007.HK) and Dalian Wanda Group.

台湾周二取消了部分年度军事演习，当局加紧准备，以应对他们所说的可能是近四年来袭击台湾的最具破坏性的台风。

台湾附近每年的这个时候台风很常见，但自 2019 年以来，这个亚热带岛屿还没有直接遭受台风袭击，这促使官员们敦促保持警惕。

气象官员称，台风多克苏里被热带风暴风险列为四级超强台风，规模为1至5级，预计将进入西北偏西方向分隔台湾和菲律宾的巴士海峡，并接近台湾南部海岸附近海域，然后在中国南部登陆。

台湾国防部取消了原定于周二举行的部分主要年度汉光演习，理由是安全考虑以及需要为即将到来的风暴做好准备。

台湾气象局已发布海上警报，并表示将于周二晚些时候向南部各县发布陆地警报，敦促当地居民做好暴雨和强风的准备。

台湾总理陈建仁在脸书上发帖称，“台湾已有1400多天没有台风登陆，因此我敦促所有政府部门必须做好准备。”

“我想提醒市民不要低估台风的威胁。”

目前尚不清楚台风将如何进一步影响为期五天的军事演习，演习将于本周在全岛举行，重点是保卫岛上的主要国际机场，以及如何在中国封锁的情况下保持海上航线畅通。

在南部港口城市高雄，上周悬挂帕劳国旗的集装箱船“天使号”在台湾西南海岸沉没后，当局正忙于收集数百个漂流在海上的集装箱。
